radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal size with prominence of the periportal space, most consistent with cirrhosis. The echotexture is slightly heterogeneous. There are no focal hepatic lesions. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 2 mm. The gallbladder is slightly distended and filled with sludge. No discrete stones are identified. The gallbladder wall is thickened and edematous. A moderate amount of pericholecystic fluid appears similar or just slightly increased in amount.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Gallbladder wall thickening and edema unchanged from the prior exam.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Unremarkable except for coiled NG tube in stomach.
